title: Markar Aghajanyan
text:
Markar Aghajanyan (, ; born March 4, 1965) is a retired <a href="Iran">Iranian</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and manager of <a href="Iranian%20Armenians">Armenian</a> descent.
Career.
Aghajanyan spent most of his career playing for <a href="Ararat%20Tehran%20FC">Ararat Tehran FC</a>. He later went on to join a series of <a href="Tehran">Tehran</a>-based teams, most notably <a href="Pas%20Tehran">PAS</a>, where he won the <a href="Iran%20Pro%20League">Iran Pro League</a> division in his first season.
With the departure of <a href="Human%20Afazeli">Human Afazeli</a>, Aghajanyan was appointed the manager of <a href="Azadegan%20League">Azadegan League</a> side <a href="Damash%20Lorestan%20F.C.">Damash Lorestan</a>. The team chose not to renew his contract for the <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Azadegan%20League">2010–11 season</a>.
Aghajanyan was also a part of the coaching staff for the <a href="Iran%20national%20football%20team">Iranian national football team</a>, and he was the assistant coach during the <a href="2014%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">2014</a> and <a href="2018%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">2018 FIFA World Cup</a>s.
